column5: I've caught decent bass on small chunks off a bigger 6" senko. Like a 2" chunk works quite well also....
I personally usually use 5" for bass. I think they have more action when rigged wacky compared a smaller 3-4".
do the 5" really have that much more action than the 4", cause i only bought the 4" versions...i hope not

I really don't know for sure if the 5" have that much more action. I'm relatively new to senko fishing myself and this is just my thinking, and I may be wrong. I have some 4" too and have caught fish on them so I'm sure you'll be fine.

Not sure about action, but i use 5" coz it's bigger, ie heavier and so I can cast it further away. I guess it's not a factor for ppl fishing from boat, but i'm only from shore. And also, 4" and 5" cost the same anyway, I think
I have had my best luck with Gary Yamomoto 5" Senko in natural colours.  I have tried thinner senkos, and do not get as much interest.
